Based on the genre preferences you mentioned, I would recommend "The Country Bears" and "Training Day". 

"The Country Bears" is a family-friendly adventure film that follows the story of six friends who come together to play "The Game" as a celebration of Nick' s birthday. After a few rounds of they get separated while following a black van. Three stop in an alley so that Nick can relieve. His friends are forced into the lost black van by two druges. The other car of friends are informed by the kidnappers that if they want to see them again they have to do exactly what they say.

It is revealed that the kidnappers are a modern day Jack the Ripper duo, stalking the streets, picking up prostitutes whom they murder and mutilate. These killer/kidnappers alarmed for being followed, frame these guys. It is the mission of the remaining friends to dispose of the body to retrieve their friends.
